column4: Hello.  I noticed that synaptic keeps saying that it can't verify the signature on any of the packages.  Does anyone know what might cause this>
run: sudo apt-get update. If you give the error regarding the key I can give you the command
sounds like you added a repo and not its pgp key
It is reporting it in the standard Ubuntu packages.
doesnt mean anything. If you don't have the ke, you don't have the key
if you run: sudo apt-get update   in terminaland give the error about keys I can give you the command to resolve it
OK, I've got something really screwed up.  It's reporting that it is using ftp.debian.org as it's sources.  I have no clue why.
you shouldnt have any debian sources, ubuntu + debian debs = pain
I never installed those repositories I have no clue how they got there.   I am going to have to do a complete reinstall.
I can't find those debian archives anywhere in the /etc/apt config files
can you pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list file as well as the output of: sudo apt-get update  please
it looks at souces.list in /etc/apt
that's why it's confusing me.  I know that.  Apt-upgrade is not behaving the same as apt-get upgrade
i've never used apt-upgrade only apt-get upgrade
i'm not. i assume nothing in here
due to the wide range of skill set in the channel i treat everyone identically so details are not overlooked as assumed
OK, then if you know the name of the keyring package so I can reinstall it properly, it would help, otherwise I'll have to go on my own.
here is a script i have for pgpp keys: http://pastebin.com/f2ce47c5f
you give it the last 8 character in the error you get when yu apt-get update and it gets the key for you :D
apt-cache search key | less
you are now on ignore. I'm trying to help and you are being totally ungrateful
